meanings.definition: To run quickly with light steps
meanings.sent1: The rabbit will scamper away when it hears a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: The children love to scamper around the playground during recess.
meanings.sent3: The little puppy decided to scamper off with my shoe for fun.
meanings.sent4: The leaves scamper across the pavement in the wind, like tiny dancers.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel scampered up the tree, its tiny feet making a soft pitter-patter.

meanings.sent1: The cat's scamper across the room startled the sleeping dog.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the scamper of feet as the kids raced to the finish line.
meanings.sent3: The scamper of the mouse behind the wall made the cat curious.
meanings.sent4: The scamper of the wind through the trees sounded like a distant drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The scamper of the squirrel on the roof made me look up in surprise.
